title: Lair Of Fire
opening: Having won the day and putting Camus and his Sable Order to rout, Marth and the League moved on to the mountains in eastern Grust, to crush the last of the opposition. The surviving Grustian soldiers, in a mad attempt to hang on to their lives, took all the residents of a nearby village hostage to keep Marth from striking. However, they could not have picked a worse village to harass...

intro.speaker: Larissa
intro.line: Have the villagers given up struggling yet?

intro.speaker: Enemy Soldier
intro.line: With that ogre on the loose? Hardly, sir. All of our soldiers together still can’t contain him. The other villagers have fled into the caverns, out of reach.

intro.speaker: Larissa
intro.line: What? Grr, enough of this! The League will be here soon. Take your positions! We’ll deal with them first and cut that giant down to size later.

intro.speaker: Ymir
intro.line: Am I? I hardly feel it.

intro.speaker: Old Man
intro.line: Why would you try to take on an entire army just for our sake?

intro.speaker: Ymir
intro.line: Because you treat me like a human being. Do I need another reason?

intro.speaker: Ymir
intro.line: I’ll be standing guard outside the cavern. Nobody will hurt you, I swear it.

battle-talk.speaker: Marth
battle-talk.line: Who are you? You don’t seem to be one of Grust’s soldiers.

battle-talk.speaker: Ymir
battle-talk.line: You just keep your distance. I’m not letting anyone near the villagers in here, and that includes you!

battle-talk.speaker: Marth
battle-talk.line: You wrong me, sir. I’m here to rout the last of Grust’s army. To save you.

battle-talk.speaker: Ymir
battle-talk.line: Yeah? Well, they said the same thing when they led us down here. And look where that got us. I’m not fallin’ for the same lies twice!

battle-talk.speaker: Marth
battle-talk.line: I speak the truth. But, if my word is not good enough, so be it. Stand aside and watch us fight. Let the battle prove I mean what I say. Agreed? Either way, you are in danger here. Take the villagers and hide until this is over.

battle-talk.speaker: Ymir
battle-talk.line: ...So I’m supposed to just sit here, when I could be fightin’?

battle-talk.speaker: Marth
battle-talk.line: Just give me a chance to prove I’m here to protect you.

battle-talk.speaker: Ymir
battle-talk.line: ...Fine. I’ll stay out of it. For now. But if I find you’re lyin’ to me, I’ll split you right down the middle!

recruit-battle.speaker: Ymir
recruit-battle.line: The villagers are countin’ on me. I won’t let you through!

boss.speaker: Larissa
boss.line: We’ll never surrender to you Akaneian rabble! Long live Grust!

end.speaker: Old Man
end.line: Prince Marth, thank you. Those soldiers told us they’d protect us when they led us down here... but they were just using us as leverage, hostages to keep you at bay! If you hadn’t shown up, they might have just killed us outright in the end...

end.speaker: Ymir
end.line: Prince Marth, sorry I doubted you.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Well, at least we’ve cleared up the misunderstanding.

end.speaker: Ymir
end.line: Since you came to the villagers’ rescue, how ’bout I help you out as a way of sayin’ thanks?

end.speaker: Ymir
end.line: I’m strongest in the land! Well, second strongest, at least. I can hold my own in battle. But if you don’t want a monster in your ranks, I understand...

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Monster? You’re a giant among men, to be sure, but a hero as well! Any warrior who can fend of an entire army is welcome among us!

end.speaker: Ymir
end.line: Then count me in! Let’s see how many more armies break themselves against me, eh!
